EmailTemplate.subject: RE: finished enrolling for now - question about "annual" enrollment (1381960549.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
- - - - 90 Clean Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi David, It was so nice speaking with you today. For your reference you can find all of the details on our plans here <http://www.mbopartners.com/mbo-exec-group-benefits-2013>. Best of luck to you – I know you will be in great hands with Megan! Sara ___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <mailto:sconde@mbopartners.com>w: www.mbopartners.com <http://www.mbopartners.com/> We’ve got some serious perks you’re eligible to win when you refer a friend <http://referral.mbopartners.com/referral-program?r=conde> to MBO Partners! Ask me about them. Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com <mailto:postmaster@mbopartners.com> and permanently delete the e-mail and files. From: Sara Conde Sent: Wednesday, October 16, 2013 3:35 PM To: 'David Smith' Cc: Megan Craft Subject: RE: finished enrolling for now - question about "annual" enrollment Hi David, It was nice chatting with you today, I am sorry I caught you at a bad time. You can give me a ring to discuss but here is the late entrant dental provision <http://link.mbopartners.com/ol/0xEFfZmddHNcoUZ1%5Fu%2DNb%5Fmgz3iQN8jlq65yDbq2lMIt3kF6L7yJPEjr1YIDT8Z0dufDUUQVGpQ8xA1OE%2DSqaL9T9%5FxJA2G6Vy%5FygajWIY5BfPJm1cU8r%2D6gwHQXq4CvpmmYD2cgWUg%2DaA2tXbw4qgX%5FJKkUUxCGzUqYGKMBlAcspO0pzKe%5FR7mO816ppRT%5F5hiWGGVx7fjJ30iSFq9htuM072w%2D3l0Id%2Dz%2DzwHE2pIdsSs4%2DLVjvSRB%5FP4gdcJS1TGdZym687bAZbhsT4Ork%5Funtv97PkY02LMnemSAGmmHAI2idC5k8CuimQ8PADxUEWVDC702gRGy6HVzUNEYRSmWjStwx2gN5opB2r7Oqyu2ZG7oNgL2mB3ymguDCIg79SGHn%2DgG9gPeEw%5Fs8cV1U2K5Gszo%2DR7tANaL/1gwVMM7QNFhXs0g45v6WMqj%5FizvFaIvmuLNwRuX1ncI81gd3f%2D3IPVKgpfF%2DI6Izd%5F2QBBADLLFy0wNbE%2DGBeb9k%5F%5FtJCk2Nej7xhafTe55xI%2DQij49x%2D6761WsRlcmNmQGeEXova0tmRwDMS482oRPNdcIFByys1i3lYIs7pAEMvKQIw4CdZYHxqVWU5ReQ2gCdLXhIw%2Dia5mm7ScpO3oQl> I am referring to: “ An employee who does not enroll within 31 days of first becoming eligible or due to a qualifying event is subject to the Late Entrant Provision. Late Entrants are employees who will have a 12-month waiting period for Basic and Major services. All diagnostic and preventive services are covered regardless of whether they are classified as Type A - Preventive or Type B - Basic. Late Entrants also have a 24-month waiting period for Orthodontia.” So, if your COBRA ran out after 18 months and you wanted to elect MBO’s dental that would be a “qualifying event” meaning you would NOT be subject to the Late Entrant Provision. If you decided to cancel your COBRA and jump on the MBO dental plan (even during our open enrollment period) you would be subject to the late entrant provision. Thanks!Sara___________________________________ SARA CONDEConsultant Services Advisor MBO Partners t: 703.793.6028f: 703.793.6068e: sconde@mbopartners.com <http://link.mbopartners.com/ol/0xEFfZmddHNcoUZ1%5Fu%2DNb%5Fmgz3iQN8jlq65yDbq2lMIt3kF6L7yJPEjr1YIDT8Z0dufDUUQVGpQ8xA1OE%2DSqaL9T9%5FxJA2G6Vy%5FygajWIY5BfPJm1cU8r%2D6gwHQXq4CvpmmYD2cgWUg%2DaA2tXbw4qgX%5FJKkUUxCGzUqYGKMBlAcspO0pzKe%5FR7mO816ppRT%5F5hiWGGVx7fjJ30iSFq9htuM072w%2D3l0Id%2Dz%2DzwHE2pIdsSs4%2DLVjvSRB%5FP4gdcJS1TGdZym687bAZbhsT4Ork%5Funtv97PkY02LMnemSAGmmHAI2idC5k8CuimQ8PADxUEWVDC702gRGy6HVzUNEYRSmWjStwx2gN5opB2r7Oqyu2ZG7oNgL2mB3ymguDCIg79SGHn%2DgG9gPeEw%5Fs8cV1U2K5Gszo%2DR7tANaL/0xkILICQIUJaukly7tyUIKb9nifUdJ26qPJ%2DBvq538Qq5lxxebGdIHTOo%2DlbP5RjR9mIJCw6VsJHmCNzNraxKYxYwtxZMli%2DTSnJmJOfPat6Yecl6vRy5oGQ%5F0kEpuiF1w%5FoTBwq>w: From: David Smith [mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com <mailto:david_t_smith@hotmail.com>] Sent: Wednesday, October 16, 2013 2:38 PM To: Sara Conde Cc: Megan Craft Subject: RE: finished enrolling for now - question about "annual" enrollment thanks Sara
I like my dental that I can continue via cobra for 18 months and it's a little less expensive than MBO... but are you saying if I go with the cobra one for the rest of this year, i can't just change to the MBO dental in open enrollment if I don't choose it in the first 30 days?

It says that MBO offers 50k of life insurance to employees, but if I want that should I check the box? If I do then it says I will be charged $9 per month. I wasn't sure if the $9 per month and checking the box is if I want just the 50k or if I want more than 50k. If you check the box (which you did) you will be covered for $50k in life insurance for $9 a month. If you want to do more you would need to do this under supplemental life section. Please be aware you have to be working at least 25 hours a week to make a claim against the life or disability insurance per Aetna. I don’t think this will be an issue for you but wanted you to know as an FYI. Please advise

Subject: finished enrolling for now - question about "annual" enrollment Date: Tue, 15 Oct 2013 20:24:32 -0700Hi Sara
Please review and let me know in the morning if I missed anything. Everything looks good – we just “flipped the switch” to reactivate you.
Also, if I was to decline for now and then 30 days go by from my activation, I understand I cannot then enroll or change. Yes, if you would like to make a change to anything other than retirement 30 days after your start date with MBO you would need a “qualifying event” (i.e. something out of your control like change in martial stats, loss of coverage, loss of job), or wait until open enrollment.
HOWEVER, if I decline for now, am I able to later enroll for coverage (medical and/or dental) during MBO's next "annual" enrollment? If so, when will that be? We have open enrollment in December for January 2014. Open enrollment is only for medical. There is a late entrant provision for dental and you would still need to do evidence of insurability (medical underwriting) for life or disability so its best to select those within the first 30 days.
)Dave
